text: I hear seven bells toll. Grandfather calls.
Collect every drop so I may slake my thirst with it.
Through your dance does Grandfather's love transmit.
You will create the faecal river that shall rise above the dam!
It doesn't just come out of the nose….
Just when you think there's no more left, the next tide rises.
Such a lovely scent… Never mind that it gives mortals nosebleeds.
Not long now... Soon you become one of us.
Like a fly laying its eggs, keep warm… incubate.
The natural state of all of Grandfather's followers.
They are gifts to be treasured until they burst.
Once they fall off, they don't grow back...
You don't need eyes to see. He will show us the way.
The mind decays... One of Nurgle's seven humours.
You can hear the bones breaking inside the flesh.
Nice and ripe, ready for further infection.
It comes out of every orifice.
It starts with flakes of skin, then clumps of flesh and hair, before whole limps slough off the victim.
The Black Plague spreads quickly, beginning as dark blotches under the skin that soon cover the entire body.
The Green Pox ravages many a face with large sores that weep a green ooze, accompanied by a high fever.
A vile palsy that causes the poor victim to involuntary shudder, becoming increasingly intense until organs mash and eyes burst.
The infamous plague that has never been bettered – Nurgle’s greatest accomplishment, the most contagious and deadly of all.
